verse:
तस्यारविन्दनयनस्य पदारविन्दकिञ्जल्कमिश्रतुलसीमकरन्दवायुः ।
अन्तर्गतः स्वविवरेण चकार तेषां सङ्‌क्षोभमक्षरजुषामपि चित्ततन्वोः ॥

vedabase.translation: When the breeze carrying the aroma of tulasī leaves from the toes of the lotus feet of the Personality of Godhead entered the nostrils of those sages, they experienced a change both in body and in mind, even though they were attached to the impersonal Brahman understanding.
vedabase.purport: It appears from this verse that the four Kumāras were impersonalists or protagonists of the philosophy of monism, becoming one with the Lord. But as soon as they saw the Lord’s features, their minds changed. In other words, the impersonalist who feels transcendental pleasure in striving to become one with the Lord is defeated when he sees the beautiful transcendental features of the Lord. Because of the fragrance of His lotus feet, carried by the air and mixed with the aroma of tulasī, their minds changed; instead of becoming one with the Supreme Lord, they thought it wise to be devotees. Becoming a servitor of the lotus feet of the Lord is better than becoming one with the Lord.

terms.तस्य: of him (referring to the Supreme Being)
terms.पदारविन्दकिञ्जल्कमिश्रतुलसीमकरन्दवायुः: the breeze carrying the fragrance of a blend of lotus flowers and tulsi leaves
terms.अक्षरजुषामपि: even in those established in the knowledge of the eternal reality
terms.चित्ततन्वोः: of the expansion of consciousness within the mind

gpt.meaning: The verse describes the Supreme Being with lotus like eyes. Through His own brilliance, He created the breeze carrying the fragrance of a blend of lotus flowers and tulsi leaves, permeating within. This divine fragrance has the power to agitate even the minds of those established in the knowledge of the eternal reality.

bard.meaning: The lotus-eyed one's lotus-feet mixed with pollen of basil and honey, entered within by its own nature, caused disturbance even of the minds of the devoted to the immutable.
